subject: Re: Mock objects...
msgSnippet: Greetings, ... om/mockobjects/dynamic/ Mock.html ... what ... the message ... Yeah, JBR mentioned jMock, and I went looking at it, and it s mentioned at the
messageBody:
Greetings,

--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, Jason Rogers <jacaetevha@f...> wrote:
> On Friday 16 July 2004 08:37 pm, cypherfox wrote:
>
> You could have used dynamic mocks (a la
> http://mockobjects.sourceforge.net/javadoc/1.4/c
om/mockobjects/dynamic/
Mock.html
> or http://mockobjects.com/DynaMock.html) wherein you tell your mock
what
> calls, results, and constraints are expected. Then you just send
the message
> verify() to the mock at the end of the test.

Yeah, JBR mentioned jMock, and I went looking at it, and it's
mentioned at the bottom of the DynaMock page... Whoa,
that's some VERY deep magic. I've got the idea, and I can
see how it would definitely help. Now I need to dig into it,
and really wrap my mind around it.

-- Morgan Schweers
